website_summaries.verdict: The Netgear WNDR4000 makes a very good wireless router for home use, especially with Wi-Fi clients that support the 5GHz band.
pros: The Netgear N750 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router (WNDR4000) supports the new 450Mbps standard on the 5GHz band, and offers true dual-band, decent wireless performance, and other advanced networking features, such as guest networking, network storage, and Live Parental Controls, for a comparatively affordable price
cons: The Netgear WNDR4000's 2.4GHz wireless throughput degrades a great deal as range increases
The performance of the network storage feature could also use some improvement

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable router with great firmware update
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this router for about 8 months, and it's been very reliable. The only complaint I had was the website administration screens were a little complex. Not unmanageable...just built by engineers for engineers. I updated the firmware yesterday, and the GUI is a huge step forward. It's slick. Apple slick. Well designed. The information you want to see (i.e. user name and passwords) is prominently displayed with setting details accessible in a single click away. Managing the guest account (internet access only) is incredibly easy. Turning bands on and off is simple. It's range is great covering my entire single story 3,900 sq ft home. This has been a great piece of equipment for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jordan

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.  Excellent dwelling coverage.
customer_reviews.text: Had to wait about a month on this product only because it was a pre-order. Otherwise, order was great. I am a big Netgear fan. This is at least my 4th Netgear wireless router never with a complaint. Linksys would probably be one of my choices however, I do not like their software interface in the least bit. Would consider D-Link also. Back to this router, I have a 3 story house (Basement, ground floor, top floor, around 4000 sq ft). The previous router had somewhat weak signal upstairs as the wireless router and ethernet switch are in the basement. This router has fixed that problem and increased speed of data transmission as well. Netgear did very well once again!
customer_reviews.author: Erik B

customer_reviews.title: Definite improvement. Easy setup. LEDs are a bit too bright
customer_reviews.text: Love the speed boost I got from trading my old Netgear for this one. Now I get the full download speed my subscription says pretty consistently throughout the day. It took about 20 minutes to get this online with my modem and set up both networks. Adding my printer was as simple as pushing the button on the router - no password entry required from the printer. This little button is great. My one peeve is that the LED clarity makes the lights incredibly bright. Even turned around against the wall its distracting in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: snooz-day

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router. installation was easy.Set-up was fast. I replaced my linkys wrt54gs, which was 4 years old and I replaced my old motorola modem with Motorola sb6120 3.0...What a diference> " I felt the need for speed " and I got it. My wife on I are your basic internet surfers,email, facebook,paybills & buy products on the web. The websites come up faster, However the big improvement is my Roku streaming,no more dropped movies while I'm watching, especially HD movies.It's a good looking router with a nice stand. I highly recommend this router if you feel the need for speed.I almost forgot. Thanks Amazon for a great product for a good price and fast deliverly...RTP
customer_reviews.author: RTP

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey, but a nice router
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty expensive when I got it, but it's got a lot of nice features. Media sharing, check. Dual frequency, check. Optional isolation of 2.4 and 5 GHz radios (great to give a guest internet access without giving them mindlessly easy home network access), check. Don't buy this expecting enterprise WAP range, though. It carries a decent ways for it to work well in most homes, but I was losing the signal within 50'. And if you don't like seeing what appears to be a tiny UFO parked in your house when the lights are off, either invest in 8" of electrical tape like I did or look elsewhere. Other than those minor gripes, I'd still buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Abstract Error

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfactory.
customer_reviews.text: I like the guest channel feature since I have guests often. I leave the guest channel open as I have acreage and my home is very isolated. It works in the entire house (7200 square feet) and on the grounds near the house. Excellent signal strength in every area. It more than keeps up with the satellite signal, never seems to get bogged down and powers at least 8-9 peripherals (fax, voice, printers, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: bob23

customer_reviews.title: Netgear N750
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this router in May 2011 from Amazon. Worked fine until this month (July 2012). Will not connect to internet. Went thru troubleshooting for entire system, including cable modem. Everything works when connected directly to cable modem. One year warranty had expired (BTW Netgear on July 1, 2011 started a Limited Lifetime warranty on this product which does not help me). Netgear Support wants more money than a new one to extend support on this one. Will not talk to you until you pay. Swapped router out for my old DLink DIR655....everything works fine. This was my first Netgear product. Will not buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: S Sandro

customer_reviews.title: Decent features, terrible range
customer_reviews.text: I was interested in this router to replace an earlier model and provide me with better range and better features. The software features are decent in this model - nothing outstanding but solid options for the majority of functions. However, the range on this is terrible! Netgear make a huge deal out of this router having one of the best ranges of their product and it does not even come close to the hype. In fact, the range is significantly less than my previous model. If you're using this as a wired router then you should be satisfied but if you want wireless range you should look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Calif Martial Artist

customer_reviews.title: Netgear N750
customer_reviews.text: This Netgear N750 router was better than average. Setup for me was almost plug and play. I didn't really need to config. anything. As a dual band router, the "N" router part performed very well in my house. I have very good signal strength through out my house even in the basement. The 5 gig high speed side of this dual band router in my opinion was a waste. Performance on the high speed prove to be much slower than the regular "N" router speed. Overall, it's not a bad router. If you find it at a good sale price go for it. Again, if you're counting on the 5 gig aspect of this router - don't.
customer_reviews.author: tango

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Received this router two weeks ago. Much more than I needed, but previous routers were so disappointing I didn't want to run the risk of another low cost failure. I have never been able to watch streaming video without ridiculous stopping, usually within the first twenty seconds. Videos, you tube type, were impossible. Haven't had anything but perfect success with this router. So very happy. Setup I used was pretty much plug and play. Haven't explored the other stuff. It's doing what I wanted and that's made me a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: M Griswold

customer_reviews.title: Awesome modem with very impressive results!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the refub modem on Friday and it arrived on time on Monday. I had a Super G Belkin modem for last few years and wanted something that would allow for better streaming downstairs to Hulu and multiple users. Hooked up the modem (don't forget to unplug your modem and hook back up to release IP), install software, and gave it a test. I ran a speed test on my laptop downstairs with old modem and then again with new. Old- 10M download and 1.39 Up New Netgear Dual N- 28M down and 2.1 up- AMAZING! WAY beyond what I expected! Thx, Mike
customer_reviews.author: Mike Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router!
customer_reviews.text: I had a very basic Netgear router previous to this one and it worked well so I stayed with the brand. I have also used Dlink and Linksys (Cisco) but their firmware/software is not as good in comparison. This WN4000 has great user friendly software making setup easy. The upgrade feature works well. I will note that I have had other brands fail after software updates and the default reset did not help. This router has great wireless setup and login features and good range. I was going to get the model above this one but I don't seem to need it.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus Decimus Meridius

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Good range
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned that I wouldnt be able to get this set up easily or use it in my basement or upstairs because of the reviews I was seeing, butI had no problems. Set up was easier than getting the stupid cable internet set up. Really. It was all set up and secured in about 10 minutes. I've been using it for about 2 weeks and have no problems at all with speed range. I have it set up in my living room on the main floor of my townhouse. I can use it in my basement and upstairs in my bedroom without sacrificing speed. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mullgirl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic router
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to do the unthinkable, transmit from my house to another building 60 yards away and actually work. It did it and it does it with about half the speed, which I consider good. There are more options on this router than I have abilities and I hope to use many of them as I learn how to use the options. There have been no drops and no compat. issues. It has by far exceeded my previous router (which did have n capabilities as well). I would gladly pay the price for this unit again.
customer_reviews.author: corinth1213

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Dual Band Gigabit N router
customer_reviews.text: I had many problems with my old Linksys e3000. I thought Linksys will stable and fast. NO ! slow down by itself then I have to reboot and will fast again. I have to do this 2-3 times a day. So I ordered Netgear WNDR4000. set up was easy. It took abput 5 minutes. then my smart wifi on my notebook show 450mbp all around the house. I walked all the way to my back yard and it show 270mbp !!!! can't belive it. so far so good (7 days)I remember I couldn't take my notebook go out side my house anywhere with Linksys e3000. It is a great buy. I'm so happy with WNDR4000
customer_reviews.author: V. Visuthikosol

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Product!
customer_reviews.text: This product has done everything it promised. I now have excellent wireless service in my home--everywhere. My phone and nook switch automatically to wi-fi when I come home, thus I have been able to decrease my Verizon bill. Installation did not go exactly as they said in the instructions, but I worked it out with little trouble--and I am by no means very knowledgeable about electronics. I only wish I had this earlier so I would not have wasted my time and patience with the cable store's models and horrible service. The price was great, delivery was fast. A+++
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Very user-friendly manual set up - I did not use the set up wizard. Excellent features, and range. I was looking for the best 750 mbps router (simultaneous access on both bands using an intel 6300 wireless), and I am satisfied I got the best router currently available. Only negative is router reverts to factory settings if without power for over six hours. Not a problem for me because I use a ups and if I intentionally remove power for extendeed periods I reload settings from a backup config file.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie W

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my NETGEAR N600 Wireless-N Dual Band Router WNDR3400. The problem with this old router was after maybe a year or two of use it started becoming very unstable, and disconnected very frequently. I would disconnect literally every 2 minutes or so, and could never load any videos without disconnecting from the internet. Now this new one, WNDR4000 is super easy to set up and has very good performance. Never disconnected once or had any problems. Let's hope it stays that way for a very long time!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Apparently, Netgear router are made to have a lifespan ...
customer_reviews.text: Apparently, Netgear router are made to have a lifespan of approximately two years before they start dropping Wifi signals and have to be restarted every few hours. This has happened to me now two times with Netgear's low-quality products, but it won't be happening again as I am defecting to anything BUT Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and good speed... now problems
customer_reviews.text: I've had the product now for a few days, it was very easy to setup and has been super stable. Spend all of yesterday with two VPN connections running through it (both IPSEC and PPTP) and it never dropped. I'm getting reasonable speeds through the connection... 100mbps w/o too much trouble. So far no complaints. UPDATE: After using it for a number of months, I've been having problems. It can't keep the 5GHz connections consistently, have talked with Netgear and will probably return it.
customer_reviews.author: Greenkiwi

customer_reviews.title: Loses Connection, Goes Off and On Randomly
customer_reviews.text: After working for a while the Netgear WNDR 4000 began dropping Internet connection, the lights would go on and off randomly. Became completely useless. I agree with all the other reviewers who had the same dropped connection problems. The strange thing is, I pulled my slow old Netgear MR814 out of the closet and it works just fine. But the much more expensive WNDR 4000 is junk.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: good purchase, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old Netgear router. Before this one, I have tried TP-Links and Belkin, one didn't work well, the other one's power supply didn't work at all. So far, this one works well, my new laptop can find the 5GHz signal, but the old laptop does not have 802.11 n wireless adapter, so it can only uses the 2.4GHz . Even though the signal band is the same, the strength of signal is better than before. Happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Baorun Huang

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating experience...Tootcome and Amazon will not receive my high-dollar business ever again.
customer_reviews.text: Dead 88 days after purchase. Seller is rude. Amazon backed them up. Amazon's A to Z warranty is a joke. Just blew 153.00. Router died. With NetGears help, we resurrected it...for about an hour and it failed again. Will use Bestbuy or Costco in the future. Better return policies. I could understand their policies if I had just changed my mind...but to have an important tool in my house outright fail and not receive repair or replacement is truly unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Good router, firmware good after update
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to run the update as soon as possible. This works well with my network. The DynamicDNS service only supports one commercial service instead of providing a generic interface, but this is a little used feature. As a techie, I do a manual setup, so I can't speak to the automatic setup, but I know it has one. Bottom line is that this is an effective wireless device.
customer_reviews.author: Plasmarobo

customer_reviews.title: My first wifi router
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a Wi-Fi router and it has been great. Setup was way easier than I had thought and the speed and quality of the signal are outstanding. With my new Blu-ray player(see other review) it has turned my 4 yr old flat screen into a smart tv. As I have only had it for a month or so, I can't say much about longevity but so far so good I would recommend this item to a friend
customer_reviews.author: O. Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research for a new router. I replaced my old "G" rated router for more speed and the higher frequency of the 5Gz service. This was to future proof my network. The only odd thing is with 2 laptops, two wireless smart TV's, two wireless Blue-Ray players and 3 smart phones, and a wireless printer only one device uses the 5G. This router was very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: jkhughes

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work very long
customer_reviews.text: Here were the steps that happened 1. Wifi started going out, and a hard reset was needed 2. Called internet company, they said everything was fine on their end 3. Called Netgear, they changed a bunch of settings and updated filmware and it worked again for about 2 hours 4. Had to start using an ethernet cable from the router to my computer 5. Had to start going directly from the modem to my computer Don't waste your money, this only lasted 18 months for me.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: DD-WRT!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this router refurbished. Shipping was super fast! Installed DD-WRT on it so I can't comment on the stock firmware issues. The wireless works good. Both G and N. Everything on the router is super fast. The only issue I see is that there are no Antennas. The G runs good throughout the house but the N drops off a little. Might be that I was using my phone to test the N though. So draw your own conclusions.
customer_reviews.author: ITguy

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't Recommend It
customer_reviews.text: Two stars for appearance only. My device worked but the disc wouldn't so I couldn't take advantage of the so called easiest setup ever. Sought online links and help but nope still didn't work. Spent hours on it and finally once operational couldn't keep the network secure due to glitches with the password set up. The range was no better than my existing router and the speed... no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn D

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot of routers before choosing this one. I can't recommend it enough. We have two laptops, two tablets, two smart phones and streaming on two TVs. Our network speed is vastly improved (not too hard considering how old the last router was), and there has been no signal dropping that I've noticed. Streaming on Amazon Prime and Hulu (through PlayStation) still requires some buffering at the beginning, but no problems throughout the programs. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Rusak

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my d-link di-524
customer_reviews.text: yeah, i know, i lived with d-link di-524 too long ... it was a nice device but, became useless with speed it had .. so, Netgear WNDR4000 N750 Dual Band Gigabit Wireless Router was amazing upgrade. I have it few months now and it stays ON 24/7. No issues. The easiest set up ever! Wow ... Price was great. Better then elsewhere online. Stores are always more pricy. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: iReview4U

customer_reviews.title: netgear n750 mistake
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble with my lower end netgear product pushing the signal downstairs to my media room and my blu-ray player,so I bought the n750 with their claim that the signal would be strong enough to cover the whole house. Turned out that the n750 was not as good as the old unit. Spent a lot of money for nothing. Spent six hours with technician setting it up. Got to be something better out there.
customer_reviews.author: fisherman

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace an older Netgear model. What I like about Netgear is the similar feel their configuration screens all have. I installed this router and had it configured in less than 10 minutes which included a couple firmware updates (required two). Since installation, it's run very well and we do notice faster WIFI speeds with our wireless devices.
customer_reviews.author: garyneth

customer_reviews.title: Netgear is a great choice
customer_reviews.text: I have had two other Netgear routers and may upgrade in the near future. I am either going with the new Nighthawk or may switch over to the ASUS AC router. Both are rated very high so I don't think I can go wrong with either choice. Netgear routers are very reliable and fast!
customer_reviews.author: Michael0924

customer_reviews.title: it's a must if you constantly stream or have high speed internet
customer_reviews.text: i'm not going to go into techy details of why to get this router, all i have to say is that i have an apple tv and i like to stream content from my pc to it via wifi and ever since i've upgraded I've had a great experience, also i have a ISP that offers me 20 MBS download (avg real down speed 14MBS) but i also did notice a great improvement on my casual surfing on ipad, laptop, etc,it's a must if you constantly stream or have high speed internet
customer_reviews.author: J. Vega

customer_reviews.title: Really dissappointed with it
customer_reviews.text: vey vey disappointed with it, highly unreliable. It would loose internet connection every now and then, though when I would check my modem, internet would be there. Also getting the intenet back was a pain restarting the router, unplugging the cable would not solve the problem. Firmware was updated. Range was fine, infact the LED lights in the fronts were nice, setting it up was also simple. I wish it was more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Manik Tyagi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router!!!
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use it for the reason it has USB connectivity. I can use the USB device connected from either my media player, phone or computer without touching the USB device. It has good streaming capability but some times the Full HD movies choke and would have pauses when playing the video
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR N750 450 Mbps Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router WNDR4000
customer_reviews.text: The previous router I had before NetGear took forever to get internet access or I had to unplug and plug it back into the modem before it would work and only at low accessability. NetGear comes on immediately at full accessability. All I can say is the NETGEAR N750 450 Mbps Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router WNDR4000 Is Great and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Aurrichio

customer_reviews.title: As advertised - a good unit
customer_reviews.text: Sparse instructions, but set-up was easy and worked properly the first time. Fast and good capacity - have had three wireless laptop connections and a hardwired desktop all simultaneously sharing a cable internet connection and all had plenty of speed. Users manual can be downloaded from the net (no one spends money to produce paper manuals anymore). Overall, seems to be a very good unit that lives up to its rating.
customer_reviews.author: Motoman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good N router, no drop outs and good range. Good security and configuration options
customer_reviews.author: dknife

customer_reviews.title: Why do Netgear routers get such good reviews?
customer_reviews.text: It did not work well, often dropping connections. A newer firmware came out, so I tried to update the firmware hoping it will work better, but afterwords it never worked again, at all. I thought paying more might get me a better product, but I have since learned that this does not apply to routers. This was my third Netgear router, no more.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Chow

customer_reviews.title: Great refurbed product
customer_reviews.text: This is a true dual band router. The 2.4 GHz has great range and works through walls, floors, and ceilings (I have a tri-level townhouse with the router on the middle floor). The 5GHz gives a bit better speed, but does not work through walls. The setup wizard was easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Wagstaff

customer_reviews.title: Repeater function is useless
customer_reviews.text: Netgear repeater function is not useful. you have to turn off WPA security ,and the speed is very slow. its just more marketing bull. I will stop buying netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Beck

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in April. Died in November. AFTER investing in the support from Netgear. It would only run my PC and Laptop but no Apple products. Pulled out the old router that I had upgraded from, and it works just fine. I wanted something that would support more devices, so that is why I went with the WNDR4000. Sorely disappointed in not only the router itself, but the support from Netgear. Apple is the one that solved my problem, not Netgear. I guess if you are running PC's, it's great. But if you are running Mac, go with the Apple AirPort, wish I had.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dropping internet connection
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for about 4 months. Then it keeps dropping wireless internet connection almost once or twice every day. I have to reboot the router every time it happens. I regret buying this. There is no telephone customer service for Netgear. If I report a problem via internet, they will send me an email that contains all archaic information that does not help a bit.
customer_reviews.author: yemveeyem

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable wireless connections
customer_reviews.text: Netgear N750 is easy to setup and very easy to navigate through the admin pages. Unfortunately, after trying out various channels including the Auto option, the wireless signal drops off frequently. It is getting worse when more wireless clients are getting added to the network. I had tried various options over the last 2+ weeks and finally gave up and returning this back to Amazon. Thinking to buy "ASUS Black Diamond Dual Band Processor" as a replacement from Amazon. I am a fan of Netgear based on the past experience but unfortunately, the top of the line router didn't live up to the expectation. It is a very serious issue because of the wireless connectivity stability.
customer_reviews.author: Anitha

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install and configure!
customer_reviews.text: Some of the negative user reviews of this product made me leery about purchasing it. I didn't need to worry. From box to fully operational in under 15 minutes including a firmware upgrade. The router is stable, the gigabit ports have increased the speed of my wired network considerably. The wireless (so far) has been stable and performance has been good even though the router is at least 30 feet from the TV and BD player.
customer_reviews.author: Maddog

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, but no faster on desktop
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this router to replace two older ones that lacked gigabit capability, also hoping to improve wireless range and signal strength. Though it was easy to install, it has not improved either wireless range, speed or signal reliability over my old routers - except for some additional speed on one wired laptop. But despite a new upgraded modem from Comcast, a gigabit-capable replacement card in desktop, and several conversations with Netgear tech support, I have not been able to see gigabit speed on my Win 7 desktop... which was the primary reason for the purchase. And, inexplicably, Netgear does not have their own version of a PCIe gigabit ethernet card to work with the router. very disappointing in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: Raffles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Keeps up with my needs. Never fails me. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: good but poor range
customer_reviews.text: Speed and setup are all great but has very poor range. I get about 30 feet in my house. Have tried 3 different locations and same result. My previous Cisco router got to well over 100 feet outside the house from same location. Really disappointed in its range.
customer_reviews.author: wizcw

customer_reviews.title: great router
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast as always with Amazon. Setup was quick and easy. I am very satisfied with this router. No dropped or erratic signal loss Works as advertised. I have a desktop, laptop , ipod and tv all on my home network.
customer_reviews.author: William Jones

customer_reviews.title: Netgear WNDR4000 N750
customer_reviews.text: This unit is by far the best I have owned. I have all the security that I need with great functionality. I have had " 0" issues with this for over a year and will definitely buy Netgear, again. Good product for a fair price. Of coarse amazon makes everything hassle free when you get a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: wms

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my 1st really costly routers i bought and i can say it has lasted, also i have never had such a high speed on my network before. Thanks netgear!!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Does what it states it will do!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this new router so that I could stream Netflix, etc. to my big screen TV. It was easy to set up and it works like a charm. I get great reception on the TV, you can use any laptop anywhere in teh house and on the porch. I received a new Ipad2 and it picks up very quickly and keeps me updated on everything I want it too! This router is everything it is cracked up to be!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Crisp

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Seems to me there are only two criteria for evaluating something like a router: does it work? And, is it easy to make it work? For this router: Yes and Yes.
customer_reviews.author: Midnight Oil

customer_reviews.title: Excellent & speedy
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a flaky linksys router with this one. It was easy to setup and is fast. I will update this product review if the router starts to flake out like so many others do. This one is worth the money so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Netgear reluctant to provide any real help with the equipment ...
customer_reviews.text: Netgear reluctant to provide any real help with the equipment. That is Netgear is stuck back in the proprietary days of DEC. and HP Mini computers. The equipment does the job.
customer_reviews.author: DuGo2Guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Netgear N750 wireless router works great, the signal always comes in strong. This is best wireless router I purchased and I purchased several before I got to this one.
customer_reviews.author: John Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Netgear N750
customer_reviews.text: I have used an older model Netgear Wireless Router WPN824 for many years. I did not know how much this has been slowing my Upload and Download speeds. The new router has increased my speed times 3. I always felt the Netgear products were great but I never realized what a difference the new router would make. Great product and one very happy consumer!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rowland-Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well wit PS3
customer_reviews.text: It is a great router. Good signal throughout the whole house. The only problem is with the PS3. The system says it is getting a 75-100% signal, but it get disconnected so I have to reboot the router almost every time.
customer_reviews.author: Krieger

customer_reviews.title: One of the easiest routers I've had the pleasure to ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the easiest routers I've had the pleasure to set up -- straight forward and no real need to read documentation, it's all there OSD.
customer_reviews.author: OldDad

customer_reviews.title: Awful enough to be recalled. should have read reviews.
customer_reviews.text: If this product actually worked, it would be the cat's A$$ (awesome). But it doesn't. I tried one, it crashed several times, I exchanged it and the replacement crashed several times. It would start failing only a few hours after starting up and would never stay up more than three days straight. Other reviewers prove that there is certainly a hardware defect that causes it to burn out within 3 months. I'm returning it now, I'm looking at the Apple AirPort Extreme and the Cisco RV220W.
customer_reviews.author: Alan F. Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to increase the range of my wifi. Unfortunately, this did no better than the dlink router that it replaced. Only by using a slingbox and both routers was I able to get the range I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W.

customer_reviews.title: Performance did not last.
customer_reviews.text: Update: After using it for months I am considering a new router the wireless G performance degraded and is not adequate making some of my devices almost unusable. I tried using a old router to serve the rest of the devices but the Netgear would not keep the settings. It will work for a wile then fail.The wireless N performance is very good but I expected better backward compatability. It is a significant upgrade in speed from my old router but only using the N capabilities Wireless G performance is much worse after a month. It was initially good everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on this threw different pc mags and recommendations threw consumer reports. This router fixed a ton of issues I was having with my old router! I use cox cable network. and it works great
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Everything I expected from Netgear!!
customer_reviews.text: I got the router to replace an older netgear router. The old one was still working well but I thought it was time to upgrade after 8 years of faithful service. Everything went well. Installation was easy!!! It was up and running in a matter of minutes. Product documentation was clear and easy to follow. The product works very well and I am once again pleased with netgear. I have not owned another product, so I can't comment on any other. However, anyone looking to get a router or upgrade, netgear is worth looking into.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: We have had this router for almost a year now and it is still working great. The dual band feature works like it should and the wired and wireless speed is great. I would recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Elmer Fudd

customer_reviews.title: Strong Qualities; Haven't pushed it to the max yet
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a problems with the router resetting or overheating. We do, however, store and operate it in the upright position. Express setup is extremely easy and the router is reliable. Hoped it would reach higher speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: alil prob no bigy though
customer_reviews.text: at first i had this laying flat and i had problem with it over heating and shutting off... so i put it on the vertical stand it came with and i havent had a problem sence.
customer_reviews.author: scotty

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these Netgear routers. One for my son and one for myself. Great distance, very strong signal inside and outside. I own a three story house and have used wifi devices on all three levels. Great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hagins

customer_reviews.title: It fiunctions great
customer_reviews.text: the only reservation i have is that for some reason it will not let me use symbols when i am creating my password and that kind of irks me but otherwise it has been awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hiltbrunn

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 7 months!
customer_reviews.text: I am disgusted with this product, well actually the Netgear support is really the drag. Actually, the product worked fantastic until September (I purchased it in February). Increased internet speed, easy to install. But now that the 90 day support is not free and the Netgear folks say the hardware is ok (I question that as sometimes the lights are on and sometimes they are not), I need to pay to have them help me with figuring out why it is malfunctioning. I'd like to send it back to them and they can keep the support. I'll use the money I'd spend on the support to buy a different product that works.
customer_reviews.author: Jangal

customer_reviews.title: Great router, Fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a fast router for what I do, mainly email and some web surfing but also plays movies with no problems. I have few devices running off of it as well. I am probably not even close to using its full potential. It doesn't have quite the range I was hoping for but still much better than my old one. My expectations may be unrealistic too, I don't know. Overall, I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: carsrus

customer_reviews.title: Very easy installation
customer_reviews.text: This was the easiest instalation of any router that I have used. I used the CD install for hooking up to my PC and the push button WPS install for my WiFi internet HDTV. It only took minutes and the router performance so far looks to be very good.
customer_reviews.author: Park City Skier

customer_reviews.title: Broke completely after 1 1/2 years
customer_reviews.text: Woke up one day and the unit had completely died - just after the warranty expired.. It no longer shows any signs of power or life even after cord replacement. Way too expensive a product to break this easily. Total ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: mp

customer_reviews.title: Nice router with a small glitch
customer_reviews.text: In terms of speed/connectivity, I'd say it beats my cisco and other netgear product. However, the ready share works doesn't work as expected. From my network enable TV, I can access to a USB drive connected to WNDR4000 intermittently. Sometime it just disappear!!!.
customer_reviews.author: BlueMoon

customer_reviews.title: Poor Netgear Customer Support Experience
customer_reviews.text: The router works well. However I had a terrible experience with Netgear Customer support. The only way Netgear could help with my query was to purchase the additional support which effectively doubled the price of the router. My son had an assignment due and I was over a barrel so I had to agree. I will never buy another Netgear product because of my customer support issue.
customer_reviews.author: LAroo

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I would have to say that i have been using Netgear for several years and i have had no problems in using them... I have chosen to upgrade my Netgear product for wireless as i currently have High Speed Internet and i have a lap top that uses Wireless N and since i have installed this product it's been supper fast on both my desktop and lap top and there is no slowdown for me... Netgear has not let me down and i will continue to use thier products in the future...
customer_reviews.author: TAZELP

customer_reviews.title: Netgear N750 Router
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to set up. Excellent range. The thumbdrive is great for sharing data, etc. between computers. Netgear support and downloads are among the best.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Newman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Router!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this router! I bought this router to increase the speed of video streaming to my WD TV Live boxes. Works flawlessly. Was easy to install, has tons of features, and fast enough to handle all 10 of my WiFi enabled devices while streaming video across the house.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: I love my Netgear router
customer_reviews.text: I love my Netgear router. My house is over 2000SF and multilevel and the router provides the best connection for my wireless PC.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Katrivesis

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty pleased with this product. Haven't had any issues as of yet
customer_reviews.author: Rhearay

customer_reviews.title: Early impressions are great
customer_reviews.text: We bought this router about a month ago and our early impressions are great. It was easy to set-up and we've had great internet speed throughout our two-level apartment for our three computers and iPad. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because it's still early and we have yet to figure out some of the more advanced functionality. Once we see how that goes and how the router holds up, I'd feel more comfortable giving it 5.
customer_reviews.author: UST1226

customer_reviews.title: mediocre range
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router for the improved range, and it actually came 10 feet shorter than my el-cheapo belkin router, Even with the 5Ghz signal. Don't believe the hype of "rangemax".
customer_reviews.author: Leo's dad

customer_reviews.title: Good router UNLESS you use port forwarding
customer_reviews.text: I found this router to be easy to set up and it performed well EXCEPT for port forwarding. I have successfully used Netgear routers for port forwarding before with no issues, but have been unable to get this model to perform that function.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Love it...so much better than my last router...
customer_reviews.text: Works just the way i wanted it. Its fast, reliable, and does great multiplayer gaming for my xbox :P. They only reason i rated it 4 stars instead of 5 is because when im doing multiplayer om my console, and when my parents get on there computer, i either lag a little bit, or agg...aLOT. Overall, i would say that this router does its job, it just need a bit of work of multitasking its internet wifi without lagging...
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly. I have had it now for well ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. I have had it now for well over six months. It does take a few minutes to set up, but well worth the time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Imran Mohamed

customer_reviews.title: Great router.
customer_reviews.text: This router is amazing. I purchased a previous netgear router and this one has not had any drop connection once. It connects to all my old devices and new devices.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Fish.

customer_reviews.title: I also recommended this to my friends
customer_reviews.text: Much more faster than my old ones. I also recommended this to my friends, one of them even bought this for his company. Hopefully, this could be still functional in couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extended Range is nonsense
customer_reviews.text: This product is supposed to have extended range...untrue...virtually unusable at 60 feet. If your application is at 30 feet or less, it is a good product. Need range beyond 30 feet, don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lee  Watkins

customer_reviews.text: 5* TkU - excellent product, most bang for your buck. I have tried the rest - I think this is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Roswic

customer_reviews.title: Netgear N750
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I have been disapointed in this product. I have discontinued the use of it and resumed using my D-Link router. I was unable my download speeds were under 500 kbs using the Netgear, where as my old D-Link speeds are 1.3 mbs. I had hoped this Negear would be an improvement, but I'm ready to garage sale it.
customer_reviews.author: SteveB

customer_reviews.title: NetGear N750
customer_reviews.text: I had two Cisco routers. The first died 7 months in. The second tried to catch fire after a 3 1/5 hour struggle to set it up. Only one computer after all the time. My brother advised NetGear and it has been OK so far but it had to be unplugged once, because it lost an assignment IP, and it reassigned all hardware new IP addresses. My main computer was no longer .01. The reassignment took a while. So far so good 6 weeks in and time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: G Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely needed for Wi-Fi in the house
customer_reviews.text: Cable does connect but they do not offer broadcasting. So Netgear is a must have router. It works so Mac installation is not easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jerzy E. Henisz

customer_reviews.title: Netgear easy install
customer_reviews.text: This item was wonderful. No headaches. Instructions held true. Simple and easy to install. I was pleased and surprised. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrelly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a must. Not the fastest however, fast enough to handle four to five WiFi enabled devices while streaming video across the house. It was easy to set up and the Netgear Genie app has some cool features.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Set up was very easy. No problems after owning this unit for 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Turner

customer_reviews.title: so far good
customer_reviews.text: so far is so good i felt the difference between the last router and this one. I will change my Internet provider for best results i recomend it
customer_reviews.author: Mainor Arcia Madrigal

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR ROUTER
customer_reviews.text: GOOD WORKING PRODUCT - NO PROBLEMS WITH OPERATION,EASY TO CONNECT AND SET-UP,PRICE IS GOOD.RECOMMEND TO OTHER BUYERS TO GET THIS ONE.
customer_reviews.author: Admiral

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: I was sorry to replace my old linksys router of 9 years but it got hit by a hurricane. This one is great. The dual band is great.
customer_reviews.author: liza

product_meta.title: Netgear WNDR4000 N750 Dual Band Gigabit Wireless Router
product_meta.description:
The NETGEAR N750 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router offers high-performance wireless speeds of up to 450 Mbps needed for demanding applications, such as large file transfers, streaming HD video and multiplayer gaming. Dual band technology avoids interference, ensuring top speeds and the highest range, while Gigabit offers ultra-fast wired connections.

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER


BEST SPEED FOR HD VIDEO – HIGH PERFORMANCE
The NETGEAR N750 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router offers maximum-performance wireless speeds of up to 450 + 300 Mbps needed for demanding applications, such as large file transfers, streaming HD video and multiplayer gaming. Dual band technology avoids interference, ensuring top speeds and the greatest range, while Gigabit offers ultra-fast wired connections.

The NETGEAR Difference – WNDR4000  *  Lifetime Warranty 
 * Simultaneous Dual Band 300+450Mbps 
 * DLNA Media Streaming

Applications Best Speed for HD Video – High Performance Access and Share USB Storage Media streaming within the home 
NETWORK SPEED
Faster Wi-Fi Speed – N750 Dual Band WiFi delivers 300 + 450Mbps for combined wireless speeds up to 750Mbps Gigabit Wired – Gigabit Ethernet LAN ports are ideal for HD gaming & video and ultra-, high-speed wired networking WIRELESS RANGE
Ultimate Range – Powerful WiFi amplifiers deliver improved wireless range for larger homes RELIABLE CONNECTIONS
Simultaneous Dual Band – Wireless access on both 2.4- and 5-GHz bands concurrently, reduces WiFi interference & doubles total available bandwidth EASE OF USE
NETGEAR genie™ – Easy-to-use dashboard to monitor, control & repair home networks CD -Less Installation – Easy setup for iPads, PC, MAC computers, smartphones & tablets without a cd Push ‘N’ Connect – Secure push button WiFi connections using WiFi Protected Setup (WPS) WiFi & Power On/Off – Convenient power savings to power down the entire router and/or just WiFi SHARING
DLNA Media Server – Find and play media stored on an attached USB storage device on DLNA TVs, game consoles and media players ReadySHARE® USB – Wirelessly access and share USB hard drives SECURITY
Live Parental Controls – Centralized and easy-to-use website filtering for all devices connected to the Internet via the router Guest Network Access – Separate and secure WiFi access for guests using your home network CHOOSE THE WIRELESS ROUTER THAT FITS YOUR NEEDS
